description: Application under Section 73 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) for variation of Condition 2 (approved plans and documents) and removal of conditions 3 (relocation of community centre), 16 (Oil / Petrol Interceptors) and 33 (Restricted uses within use class D1)of planning permission P/2011/5047 dated 11/09/2012 for Redevelopment of Phases 1 and 2 of the Rectory Park Estate regeneration scheme, comprising the demolition of garages and storage sheds to the eastern side of Rectory Park Avenue and 102 residential units located at 1 to 95 (odd); 2 to 26 (even); 214 to 220 (even); and 251 to 303 (odd) Rectory Park Avenue, and the re-location of a community centre (of a minimum gross external area of 178 sqm) and the erection of 160 new residential units (37 no. 1-bedroom, 84 no. 2-bedroom, 1 no. 3-bedroom flats and 8 no. 2-bedroom and 30 no. 3-bedroom houses), together with new and altered roads and footpaths, refuse and recycling storage, cycle storage, car parking for up to 108 vehicles, public and private amenity space and associated playspace and landscaping.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission, LBE ref: P/2011/5047 dated 11/09/2012.   Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to ensure that the permission is not extended beyond the sate of the original permission. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and documents:   P/2011/5047  11-125/ D101; D102A; D103; D104; D120A; D121A; D122A; D123A; D130; D131 Rev A; D140; D141; D150A; D151A; D160; D161; D164 Rev A; D165 Rev A; D170; D171A; D172; D173A; D180;  SK700; SK701; SK702; W102134L8(D13) Rev#; W102134SK24 (Disabled Parking Bays); W102134L10(D105) Rev #; W102134L11(D106) Rev#; W102134L01(D110) Rev B; W102134L02(D111) Rev D; W102134L03 (D112) Rev C; W102134L09 (D174) Rev A;   Flood Risk Assessment (ref: 10356) Rev A and Rev B; Transport Assessment, dated 25/11/2011 and Transport Assessment Addendum, dated 02/02/2012; Transport Validation Report, dated 26/01/2012; Residential Travel Plan, dated 25/11/2011 and 27/01/2012; Traffic Planning Pedestrian and Cycle Audit, dated 02/02/2012; Sustainability Checklist ref: 24725; Energy and Sustainability Strategy Report (Phases 1 & 2) (Including Code for Sustainable Homes Pre-Assessment and Addendum Report ref: 24725 Issue 01); Email response prepared by M. Connell (Jones Lang LaSalle) to Ealing Council's Energy officer comments, dated 07/03/2012;  Supplementary Document to submitted Energy Strategy (ref: K120242), dated April 2012, prepared by Calford Seaden (including indicative PV Layout plans: SK001 & SK002); Additional Information for Planning comments 1.4/ 1.11 and 1.16, received 01/06/2012; Community Heating Analysis Report (ref: K120242), dated May 2012, prepared by Calford Seaden, received 01/06/2012; Statement of Community Involvement, dated November 2011; Planning Statement, dated November 2011 and Jones Lang LaSalle response to GLA Stage 1 Response (ref: MSC/Msc), dated 21/02/2012; Health Impact Assessment; Rectory Park Management Strategy; Affordable Housing Statement; Design and Access Statement (Detailed Application for Phases 1 & 2), dated November 2011, Addendum to Design and Access Statement 'Design of Towney Mead Access' ref: W102134R18, dated 27/01/2012; Addendum to Design and Access Statement (Response to GLA Stage 1 Response), dated February 2012; Site Waste Management Plan ref: 6-G3-005-09.09.2011; Arboricultural Impact Assessment Rev A (ref: DFC 1109) and drawings DFC1109_TCP and DFC1109_TPP; Extended Phase 1 Habitat Survey ref: DFC1109; External Lighting Assessment; Air Quality Assessment and Noise Assessment, prepared by Hawkins Environmental; Ground Investigation Report ref: 11.08.019 Ver 2; Daylight and Sunlight Report ref: W711/rel3.   P/2013/1572  12-128/SK20; 11-125/D123B; D131B; D141A; D151B; D165B; D170A and Covering Letter ref: 12-128, dated 22.04.2013, prepared by bptw partnership.    Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | Condition 3 of the original planning permission ref: P/2011/5047 has been removed under Section 73 planning application reference P/2013/1572. | Prior to the commencement of the relevant part / phase of development, details of a site construction method statement/ management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The method statement/management plan shall include the following:   a) The number of on-site construction workers and details of the transport options and parking facilities for them;   b) anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site per day;   c) delivery times and booking system (which is to be staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school-run peak periods);   d) route and location of site access for construction traffic and associated signage;   e) management of consolidated or re-timed trips;   f) details of the noise / vibration and dust mitigation measures to accord with the 'Best Practice Guidance: The control of dust and emissions from construction and demolition ' (2006) and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites - Part 1:Noise;   g) wheel washing provisions;   h) details of site security and the erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate.   i) secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities;   j) vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear;   k) details as to the location(s) for storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices;   l) procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents;   m) measures to consult cyclists, disabled people and the local schools (in particular Gifford Primary School) with regard  to delivery times and necessary diversions;   n) details of all pedestrian and cyclist diversions;   o) a commitment to be part of Considerate Constructors Scheme; and   p) confirmation of use of TfL's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar    Any areas to be used for the storage of building materials or other site activities outside of the relevant part / phase of the development shall be returned to their original condition immediately following the practical completion of the relevant phase / part of the development.   The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.   Reason:  To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety, in accordance with policies 5.18, 6.3 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(f) and 1.1(j) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 4.4, 4.11, 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the provision of SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | Prior to the commencement of the relevant part / phase of the development, scaled drawings (to at least 1:100) and tracking diagrams to demonstrate that the servicing and parking requirements of the retained properties within the Rectory Park Estate will be satisfactorily provided, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   The approved arrangements shall be provided and maintained for the necessary period, in recognition of the proposals for the wholesale redevelopment of the estate (approved under planning ref: P/2011/5045).   Reason: To ensure that the phased development would be able to provide satisfactory interim arrangements for servicing, emergency access and car parking for the existing residents of the site, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004). | Notwithstanding the indicative traffic calming measures shown on the approved plans, further drawings and other supporting information providing full details of such measures to be incorporated into the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any development on-site.   The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, subject to the completion of any necessary S278 / S38 agreement with the Local Highways Authority.   Reason: To ensure appropriate measures are incorporated into the design of streets to improve the environmental conditions and safety for all road users, in accordance with policies 1.1(f) and 1.1(g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004). | Prior to the commencement of the relevant part / phase of development, a Site Waste Management Plan, including a Green Procurement Plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Site Waste Management Plan and Green Procurement Plan shall demonstrate how the procurement of materials for the development will promote sustainability, including by use of low impact, sustainably sourced, reused and recycled materials, including reuse of demolition waste. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the particulars so approved in this Plan.    Reason:  To ensure sustainable procurement of materials which minimises the negative environmental impacts of construction in accordance with policies 5.3 and 5.18 of the London Plan 2011, policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 2.1 and 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details and samples of all facing materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any work commencing on the superstructure of the relevant part / phase of development.  The samples and details shall include:   a) brickwork (including brick panels and mortar courses);   b) all window treatments (including sections and reveals);   c) building entrance details;   d) balcony structures and balustrading treatment (including sections);   e) privacy screen treatment;   f) residential and bin store entrance doors / ventilation louvres;   g) entrance gates to the car parking areas;   h) any other materials to be used.    The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.   Reason:  In the interest of securing sustainable development and to ensure that the resulting appearance of the development is of a high standard in accordance with policies: 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(h), 1.1(k), 1.2(f), 1.2(h) and 3.8  of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall be commenced on the relevant part / phase of development until details of the retention and adequate protection of all trees and tree root systems within, bordering and adjacent to the site have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and enacted (retention/protection shall be in accordance with BS 5837, 2005 'Trees in Relation to Construction').    The details shall include a site plan identifying all trees to be retained and removed in accordance with the Tree Protection Plan (DFC1109_TPP, dated 11.08.2011) and Arboricultural Impact Assessment ref: DFC 1109 (Rev A). The details shall also include the location of Root Protection Area (RPA) and Construction Exclusion Zone (CEZ) and the erection of hoardings.  Tree protecting fencing shall consist of a rigid 2.4 metre high hoarding.  Heras fencing in concrete, rubber or similar foot plates are not acceptable as a form of tree root protection.   Reason:  To safeguard the future of these trees and shrubs in the interests of the visual amenities and the biodiversity value of the area and the setting and character of the proposed development in accordance with policies: 7.21 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(i) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and SPG 9: Trees and Development Guidelines. | Notwithstanding the plans hereby approved, full details of all tree pits including their locations, dimensions and depths in relation to ground levels, underground services, car-parking bays and hard landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of works (excluding demolition and site preparation) within the relevant part / phase of the development. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.   Reason:  To secure the appropriate provision and development of the proposed street-trees and to ensure that the life of the trees would not be unduly constrained in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the details submitted within the Design and Access Statement (prepared by BPTW); Arboricultural Impact Assessment ref: DFC 1109 (Rev A) and as indicated on drawing ref: W102134L8(D13)Rev #; the details of the location, species and size of the sixteen (16) replacement street trees in Phase 1A; the twenty-two (22) replacement street trees within Phase 1B; and the nineteen (19) replacement street trees within Phase 2, shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the superstructure works associated with the relevant part / phase of the development. Street trees shall be planted during the first planting season following practical completion of the relevant phase / part of development.    Any trees or shrubs that die within five years of planting or within such time before the adoption of such areas by the Local Highway Authority, whichever is the earlier, shall be replaced with the same species or an approved alternative and to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority during the next planting season.   Reason:  To ensure the approved replacement street tree planting is provided as an integral feature of the development in the interests of the setting of the buildings and visual amenities of the locality and to enhance biodiversity within the site in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4, 7.5, and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(i) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 3.8, 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the biodiversity (green / brown) roofs and the measures within the design of the building to support such provision shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of substructure works on the relevant part / phase of the development. The details shall include:   a) biodiversity and / or sedum base with extensive substrate base covering the extent of the roof surface where achievable and reasonable;   b) sufficient depth of soil or growing medium for the relevant planting;   c) planted / seeded with an agreed mix of species within the first planting season following the practical completion of the building works;   d) relevant efficient and effective drainage and irrigation to sustain the vegetation.    The green roofs shall not be used as an amenity or sitting out area and shall only be accessed in the case of essential maintenance or repair.   The biodiversity roofs shall be provided strictly in accordance with the details so approved.      Reason:  To ensure the development provides the maximum possible provision towards the creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.10, 5.11, 5.12 and 7.19 of the London Plan 2011; 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(m) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and 3.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A landscaping scheme shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any superstructure works commencing on the relevant part / phase of the development.  The detailed landscaping scheme, which shall include details of the front garden landscaping to all flat blocks and houses, public realm landscaping, communal and private amenity spaces and designated play areas, shall include the following:   a) a biodiversity statement detailing how the landscaping scheme maximises biodiversity (including bat and bird boxes);   b) existing and proposed underground services and their relationship to both hard and soft landscaping;   c) proposed trees (excluding street trees): their location, species and size;   d) soft plantings: including grass and turf areas, shrub and herbaceous areas;   e) topographical survey: including earthworks, ground finishes, top soiling with both conserved and imported topsoil(s), levels, drainage and fall in drain types;   f) enclosures and boundary treatments, including types, dimensions and finishes of walls, fences, screen walls, barriers, bollards (in the case of Towney Mead link), rails, retaining walls and hedges;   g) hard landscaping: including ground surfaces, kerbs, edges, ridge and flexible pavings, unit paving, seating furniture, steps and if applicable synthetic surfaces (and being mindful of the requirements in relation to sustainable urban drainage solutions);   h) any other landscaping feature(s) forming part of the scheme;   i) a management and maintenance strategy for communal and publicly accessible areas of open space, principally comprised of the Park Vista and equipped playspace assocaited with the interim community centre; and   j) work phasing plan.   All landscaping in accordance with the approved scheme shall be completed / planted during the first planting season following practical completion of the relevant part / phase of the development hereby approved, or in accordance with the approved work phasing plan (j).  Any trees or shrubs that die within five years of the anniversary of planting shall be replaced with the same species or an approved alternative in the next planting season.    The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.   Reason:  To ensure the approved landscaping is provided as an integral feature of the development and that all such landscaping, boundary treatments and street furniture is retained in the interests of the setting of the buildings and visual amenities of the locality; to provide biodiversity within the site and to ensure that the use of mains water in the landscape areas is reduced through the incorporation of rainwater harvesting technologies; in accordance with policies 5.10, 5.15, 7.4, 7.5 and 7.21 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(h) and 1.1(i) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 3.8, 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the design of the playspace indicated on approved plan W102134L10(D105) Rev#, including the proposed safety surfacing and equipment / features the areas will contain and including a management and maintenance strategy, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the following:   a)	the commencement of Phase 1A of the development in relation to the equipped play space associated with the temporary community centre; and   b)	within 6 months of the commencement of superstructure works in relation to the area within Phase 2 of the development.   The children's playspace shall be provided strictly in accordance with the details so approved and installed / erected prior to the first occupation of the relevant phase / part of the development and shall be maintained in accordance with the approved management and maintenance plan thereafter.   Reason: To secure the appropriate provision and design of children's playspace, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 3.6 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 3.5 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The car parking as indicated on the approved plans, including a minimum of 16 disabled parking spaces, shall be marked out and completed together with the associated access roads and manoeuvring areas prior to the first occupation of the relevant part /phase of the development and these areas shall be kept continuously available for car and / or motorcycle parking associated with the residential development and shall not be used for any other purposes.   Reason: To ensure adequate car parking is provided and retained in conjunction with the development in the interests of the general amenities of the locality and the free flow of traffic and conditions of pedestrian and general highway safety on the neighbouring highways in accordance with policies 6.3 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f) and 1.1(g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or core) strategy 2012; and policies 4.1, 5.5 and 9.1 of the of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Condition 16 of the original planning permission ref: P/2011/5047 has been removed under Section 73 planning application reference P/2013/1572. | A minimum of twenty Electric Vehicle Charging Points shall be provided in the locations detailed on drawing ref: 11-125/SK702 prior to the first occupation of the relevant phase / part of the development and maintained as such thereafter.   Reason: In the interest of the environment and improving air quality, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 1.2(k) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012.       18.	The dedicated bicycle storage enclosures as illustrated on the approved plans shall be provided and ready for use prior to the first occupation of any dwelling in the relevant phase / part of development, and maintained as such thereafter.   Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided and retained in conjunction with the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policies 6.1 and 6.9 of the London Plan; policies 1.1(k) and 1.1(g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The dedicated bicycle storage enclosures as illustrated on the approved plans shall be provided and ready for use prior to the first occupation of any dwelling in the relevant phase / part of development, and maintained as such thereafter.   Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking is provided and retained in conjunction with the development in pursuance of the objectives of sustainability and encouraging the use of modes of transport other than private motor vehicles in accordance with policies 6.1 and 6.9 of the London Plan; policies 1.1(k) and 1.1(g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the location and facilities to provide the visitor cycle parking associated with the community centre, which shall comprise of no less that 6 spaces, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 3 months of the commencement of development, and the approved cycle storage facilities shall installed prior to the first occupation of the interim community centre hereby approved.   Reason: To ensure adequate visitor cycle parking is available to support the use of the community centre and to promote sustainable modes of transpory in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(k) and 1.1(g) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy 9.1 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan (2004). | Notwithstanding the details of the refuse / recycling enclosures set out within the approved plans and documents, further details of the design and location of the necessary enclosures to serve the new development, shown in context, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within six months of the commencement of the superstructure works on the relevant phase / part of development to which the enclosure relate.   The development shall be carried out in accordance with the details so approved and shall be maintained as such therefater.   Reason:  To secure the necessary recycling and waste enclosures to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and SPG 4: Refuse and Recyling Facilities. | Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved community centre, details of the refuse / recycling enclosures and a Commercial Services Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.    Refuse / recycling storage and the approved servicing arrangements shall be provided / carried out in accordance with the approved details, implemented prior to the first occupation of the unit and maintained as such thereafter.   Reason: To secure the necessary physical waste enclosures to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in accordance with policy 5.17 of the London Plan 2011; policies 1.1(e) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The dwellings, in accordance with the Design and Access Statement and the plans hereby approved, shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards.   Reason:  To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate to the changing needs of the future occupiers, in accordance with policy 3.5, 3.8 and 3.9 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012;  and policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | The 16 number wheelchair accessible / wheelchair adaptable dwellings, in accordance with the Design and Access Statement and plans hereby approved, shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the phase / part of the development to which they relate.   Reason:  To ensure the provision of wheelchair housing as agreed in a timely fashion that would address the current unmet housing need; produce a sustainable mix of accommodation; and provide appropriate choices and housing opportunities for wheelchair users and their families, in accordance with policies: 3.5, 3.8, and 3.9 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and SPG 7: Accessible Ealing. | All lifts serving the dwellings hereby approved shall be installed and operational prior to the first occupation of the residential dwellings in the relevant phase / part of the development.   Reason:  To ensure that adequate access is provided to all floors of the development for all occupiers and visitors including those with disabilities, in accordance with policies 3.5, 3.8, and 7.2 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 5.3 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the measures for air pollution mitigation for habitable rooms within the Ruislip Road frontage of the development (specifically Blocks 1 and 2 within Phase 1B) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval within 6 months of the commencement of the superstructure works associated with the relevant part / phase of the development.   The approved air pollution mitigation measures shall be incorporated into the development before the first occupation of the relevant part / phase of development.   Reason: The Air Quality Stage 4 Review and Assessment for the London Borough of Ealing has highlighted that this area currently experiences or is likely to experience exceedences of Government set air quality standards and air quality mitigation for the units fronting Rusilip Road East is required and it would therefore be necessary to ensure that future occupiers are not exposed to poor air quality that could have a negative impact on health and as such, mitigation would be necessary in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.14 of the London Plan 2011;1.1 (e) and 1.1(j) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and 2.6 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Internal noise levels of the approved residential units, due to external noise or noise from other parts of the development should not exceed the following:   Bedrooms (23:00 to 07:00 Hrs): 30 dB LAeq, 45 dB LAmax for individual noise events   Living rooms (0700 to 2300 Hrs): 35 dB LAeq.   Kitchens, bathrooms, WC compartments & utility rooms (0700 to 2300 Hrs): 50 dB LAeq.   [NB: All time intervals are 1 hour, time weighting is fast unless stated. Note: The levels above are recommended by the World Health Organisation and incorporated within BS8233 1999: Sound Insulation and Noise Reduction for Buildings - Code of Practice.   Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of residential amenity is provided for future occupiers, in accordance with policies 3.2 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2011; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004 and the Council's SPG10: Noise and Vibration. | Details of site-wide security measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the development.  The details shall relate to:   d)	CCTV;   e)	general lighting; and/or    f)	security lighting   The details shall include the location and full specification of: all lamps; light levels/spill; cameras (detailing view paths); and support structures.    The general security measures shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the relevant part / phase of the development hereby approved.   Reason:  To ensure that the security lighting and CCTV cameras are appropriately located and designed to not unduly affect the residential amenity of the occupiers of the development and neighbouring properties, are appropriate to the overall design of the building and are adequate to promote safety and security, in accordance with policies 7.3, 7.6 and 7.13 of the London Plan 2011, policy 1.1(e) and 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 4.1, 4.4 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the Council's SPG 8: Safer Ealing. | No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed on any of the buildings containing flats hereby permitted unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason:  To safeguard the appearance of the buildings in the interests of visual amenity; in accordance with policies 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; and policies 4.1, 4.14 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provision of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) no development to any dwellinghouse hereby approved under Classes A, B, C, D or, E of Part 1, Schedule 2 to the said Order shall be carried out or constructed without express planning permission.   Reason:  To enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain control over extensions and other alterations to dwellinghouses in the interests of the design and character of the properties, the visual amenities of the locality and amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2011, policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policies 1.1(h), 1.2(f) and 3.8 of the Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012. | The energy measures (energy efficient fabric, individual heating systems and photovoltaics) which shall together provide for no less than 25% on-site total C02 reductions in comparison with the emissions from notional buildings which comply with Building Regulations 2010, as detailed within the approved Energy and Sustainability Strategy Reports (comprised of the Community Heating Analysis (ref: K120242
